alert.note: Alert for Claiborne; Jefferson; Warren (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 6:04PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Tensas and central Madison Parishes, southwestern Warren, Claiborne, Jefferson and northeastern Adams Counties through 700 PM CST... At 604 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles north of Newlight to 7 miles northeast of Cooter Point to near Spokane to near Vidalia. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Vicksburg, Natchez, Tallulah, Alcorn, Fayette, Port Gibson, Newellton, St. Joseph, Waterproof, Rocky Springs, Stanton, Le Tourneau, Lorman, Stampley, Red Lick, Lake Bruin, Somerset, Hermanville, Afton and Yokena. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees.
